item.title: 卢拉发表有关财政平衡的言论后巴西市场下挫
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）在参议院否决了其政府关于增加公共收入的最新提案后，巴西市场下挫，加剧了人们对财政问题的担忧。【原文：Brazilian markets sank as President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva added to growing fiscal jitters just after the Senate shot down his government’s latest proposal to boost public revenue.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长金多斯称 "巨大 "不确定性导致 2024 年利率路径开放
item.description: 欧洲中央银行副行长路易斯-德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）说，欧洲中央银行今年不能预先承诺做出任何决定，因为它要面对波动的通胀和难以预测前景的经济。【原文：The European Central Bank can’t pre-commit to any decisions this year as it confronts volatile inflation and an economy whose outlook is difficult to predict, Vice President Luis de Guindos said.】

item.title: 安德鲁-勒夫在筹集最新现金后大胆做空 GameStop
item.description: 安德鲁-莱夫特（Andrew Left）平仓了他对 GameStop 公司的大胆空头头寸，因为在过去的一个月里，这家meme-stock 公司筹集了 30 亿美元，使其资本充足，股价飙升。【原文：Andrew Left closed out his gutsy short position against GameStop Corp. as the meme-stock company raised $3 billion in the past month, leaving it well capitalized and with a soaring share price.】

item.title: 两家伦敦对冲基金巨头据称将探索阿布扎比前哨基地
item.description: 伦敦最大的两家对冲基金正在考虑在阿布扎比开设办事处的计划，以巩固该市作为新兴金融企业中心的地位。【原文：Two of London’s biggest hedge funds are considering plans to open offices in Abu Dhabi, bolstering the city’s status as an emerging hub for financial firms.】

item.title: 电动汽车领导者挪威不会跟随欧盟对中国电动汽车征收关税
item.description: 挪威财政大臣特里格夫-斯拉格沃尔德-韦杜姆（Trygve Slagsvold Vedum）表示，挪威作为插电式汽车的先驱，不会加入欧盟对中国电动汽车增加关税的行列。【原文：Norway, a trailblazer in the uptake on plug-in vehicles, won’t join the EU’s increase in tariffs on Chinese electric cars, Finance Minister Trygve Slagsvold Vedum said.】

item.title: 阿布扎比阿德诺克公司（Adnoc）启动其最大的液化天然气出口终端项目
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国最大的能源公司批准了一个大型液化天然气出口终端，以开拓日益增长的全球燃料市场。【原文：The United Arab Emirates’s biggest energy company approved a major liquefied natural gas export terminal as it seeks to tap into a growing global market for the fuel.】

Drivers for Uber Technologies Inc. won a $20 million settlement, Google employees secured $27 million over complaints of free-speech violations, and Walmart Inc. agreed to pay $65 million for allegedly not providing seating to their cashiers.】

item.title: 布林肯称哈马斯的停火要求意味着战争仍将继续
item.description: 国务卿安东尼-布林肯（Antony Blinken）说，哈马斯要求对停火建议进行几处修改，这超出了该组织以前的立场，使人们对很快达成协议的可能性产生了新的怀疑。【原文：Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Hamas demanded several changes to a cease-fire proposal that go beyond the group’s previous stance, casting fresh doubt about the chances for a deal anytime soon.】

item.title: 为了新经济，银行和民间信贷需要合作
item.description: 德意志银行欧洲、中东和非洲地区资本市场联席主管霍比-布瓦特（Hoby Buvat）在接受彭博电视采访时表示，投资银行需要与私人信贷合作，以满足新经济（包括数字化和去碳化）所需的大量资本支出。【原文：Investment banks will need to work with private credit in order to satisfy the massive capital expenditure requirements for the new economy including digitization and decarbonization, said Hoby Buvat, co-head of capital markets EMEA at Deutsche Bank, speaking on Bloomberg TV.】

item.title: 在冷淡的 CPI 数据公布后，交易员充分预期美联储 11 月降息
item.description: 在一份报告显示 5 月份通胀意外放缓后，交易员们重新开始全面预计美联储将在 11 月份降息，并预计今年将降息两个季度。【原文：Traders resumed fully pricing in a Federal Reserve interest-rate cut in November, expecting two quarter-point reductions this year, after a report showed inflation unexpectedly slowed in May.】

item.title: 尼日利亚番茄枯竭给通胀带来新风险
item.description: 尼日利亚番茄价格飙升，令正在与几十年来最高的粮食通胀率作斗争的政府当局感到新的头痛，这引发了抗议和抢劫。【原文：Soaring tomato prices in Nigeria are creating a new headache for authorities, who are battling food inflation that’s at its highest in decades and has fanned protests and looting.】

item.title: Permira 任命新高层领导，开启 PE 公司新篇章
item.description: Permira 将任命两位新的联席管理合伙人，为这家管理着约 800 亿欧元（860 亿美元）私募股权和信贷基金的投资公司建立新的高层领导。【原文：Permira is appointing two new co-managing partners, setting up fresh leadership at the top of the investment firm that manages about €80 billion ($86 billion) across private equity and credit funds.】

item.title: 印度通胀略有缓解，中央银行保持警惕
item.description: 印度 5 月份的通胀率仅略有下降，仍高于央行的目标，说明决策者有必要保持谨慎。【原文：India’s inflation eased only slightly in May, staying above the central bank’s target and justifying the need for policymakers to remain cautious.】

item.title: 瑞银寻求在 ESG 领域扩张，瑞士信贷是其目标
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）刚刚召开了有史以来第一次以生物多样性为主题的环境、社会和公司治理（ESG）会议，表明了其在这一业务领域发展壮大的雄心壮志，而瑞士信贷集团（Credit Suisse）在倒闭前曾将这一业务领域作为扩张目标。【原文：UBS Group AG just held its first-ever conference dedicated to the ESG theme of biodiversity, signaling its ambitions to grow in a business area that Credit Suisse had targeted for expansion before its collapse.】

item.title: 纽约 MTA 因停止收费而准备提高借贷成本
item.description: 纽约市交通拥堵收费计划的推迟给大都会运输局的资本计划带来了 150 亿美元的缺口，同时也可能使运输机构的运营预算捉襟见肘。【原文：While delaying New York City’s congestion pricing initiative blew a $15 billion hole in the Metropolitan Transportation Authority’s capital program, it also may strain the transit agency’s operating budget.】

item.title: 前线公司首席执行官认为，即使停火，船只也会避开红海
item.description: 一家大型油轮公司的老板周三说，如果以色列和哈马斯之间的战争达成协议，商船就会重新开始在红海航行，这种想法太 "天真 "了。【原文：It’s “naive” to assume merchant vessels will start sailing through the Red Sea again if there’s an agreement to end the war between Israel and Hamas, the boss of a major oil-tanker company said Wednesday.】

item.title: 范围》称，极右翼可能会阻碍欧盟推动 5000 亿欧元的投资
item.description: 范围评级公司（Scope Ratings）认为，极右翼政党阻碍欧盟填补每年 5000 亿欧元（约合 5380 亿美元）投资缺口的前景使得汇集资本市场变得更加迫切。【原文：The prospect of far-right parties impeding European Union efforts to fill an annual €500 billion ($538 billion) investment gap makes the pooling of capital markets even more imperative, according to Scope Ratings.】

item.title: 阿根廷就与国内生产总值挂钩的债券向英国提出 15 亿美元上诉败诉
item.description: 阿根廷试图推翻英国法院关于支付 15 亿美元以赔偿投资者在该国与增长挂钩的证券上的损失的命令，但最终失败。【原文：Argentina lost its attempt to overturn a UK court order to pay $1.5 billion to compensate investors for losses in the country’s growth-linked securities.】

item.title: 美国购房申请五周来首次上升

item.title: 沙特可能放宽税收规定以提高债券对外国人的吸引力
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯计划采取一系列措施来促进其债务资本市场的发展，其中包括可能放松税收，希望这将使当地公司债券对外国投资者更具吸引力。【原文：Saudi Arabia laid out a series of steps it plans to take to boost its debt capital market, including a possible easing in taxes it hopes will make local corporate bonds more appealing to foreign investors.】
